intro: Pabstiella caraguatatubensis, commonly known as the Caraguatatuba fern, is a rare and unique species of fern native to the Brazilian state of Pará. It belongs to the family Pteridaceae and is characterized by its intricate fronds with a distinctive, delicate appearance. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Its botanical significance lies in its role as an indicator of undisturbed ecosystems and its potential for scientific study in plant biology. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
